diff_analysis.evidence: In lib/carrierwave/processing/rmagick.rb the NEW code uses `eval` to build a lambda from user-supplied options: `assignments = options.map { |k, v| "self.#{k} = #{v}" }; code = "lambda { |img| " + assignments.join(";") + "}"; eval code`. Reverting to the OLD code removes this eval-based construction and instead safely iterates over options and calls `img.public_send(:"#{k}=", v)`. Therefore, the OLD code is not vulnerable to code injection, while the NEW code is.
